TopicTitle: Is there a known bug on atmosphere transitions around 6000m?

Articles.Content:
Going to check if something got screwed up here, currently using 1.02 modded (EVAFollower, Kerbal Engineer Redux, EVAParachutes, and Professor Phineas Kerbenstein's wonderous vertical propulsion, (plugin only, with no relevant parts used) Firespitter).

Just finished a 30 min descent (sigh) so I hit the transition at less than 120m/s ~10 degrees decline; upon hitting that barrier the ship freaked out and, according to f12, rapidly switched lift vectors until it tore itself apart.

Ship is a non-operative spaceplane (just toying around) so winglets and cannards.

Will look into it with stock at some other time, was just curious if there is a known issue somewhere. (Third attempt here, hence the 30 min descent)

Edited May 10, 2015 by Fel
Dont know exactly, but atmospheric pressure does start to increase rapidly when you fall trough 6km. Any pictures of the craft?
This can be closed, extensive testing shows that module=Winglets was causing the problem.
